results.description: Used SUGGESTION1 (combined returns and liquidity) and SUGGESTION4 (both fields have high user/alpha counts). Did not use SUGGESTION2 (no vector field) or SUGGESTION3 (both coverages >0.6). Confidence 0.70 because short-term momentum is well-known but liquidity tilt reduces microstructure noise.
Applied SUGGESTION1 & SUGGESTION4 using long-window returns (high coverage/usage). No vector or backfill needed. Confidence 0.68 — classic momentum with robust history.

Combined return reversal and volatility per SUGGESTION1; used high-usage volatility field (S4). Did not use vec operators. Confidence 0.62 — reversal signal modest but cleaner when scaled by volatility.

Used SUGGESTION1: stock short-term return vs industry return. Industry fields have full coverage and reasonable usage (S4). No vector/backfill applied. Confidence 0.66 — industry-relative signals reduce sector beta.

Applied SUGGESTION1 & SUGGESTION4: used factor return series and stock returns. No vec_avg. All coverages =1 so no backfill (S3 not used). Confidence 0.64 — factor-stock correlation can time exposures.

Used SUGGESTION1 combining specific risk and returns; rsk62_1_100_ksrs has high user/alpha (S4). No vector/backfill needed. Confidence 0.72 — low-specific-risk stocks often outperform on risk-adjusted basis.
Applied SUGGESTION1 using book value and cap proxy; both have high coverage and user/alpha counts (S4). Did not use vec or backfill. Confidence 0.60 — value is slow but persistent.

Applied SUGGESTION1 using ts_ir on factor series (S2 not used as factor is scalar series operator available). Coverage=1 so no backfill. Confidence 0.62 — IR-based timing picks stable factors.
Combined momentum and specific risk per SUGGESTION1; both fields have strong usage (S4). No vec/backfill. Confidence 0.69 — reduces tail-risk from momentum.
SUGGESTION1: momentum scaled by inverse market cap proxy; both high-usage (S4). No vec/backfill. Confidence 0.66 — reduces small-cap crowding.

SUGGESTION1: difference between two factor returns with full coverage. S4 satisfied. Confidence 0.60 — divergence indicates regime shifts.
Combined reversal (returns) with liquidity (logadv); used SUGGESTION1 and S4. Confidence 0.57 — liquidity amplifies reversal effects.

Applied SUGGESTION2 by using a vector retseries and wrapping with vec_avg; SUGGESTION1 used industry and stock returns. All fields coverage=1 so S3 not needed. Confidence 0.63 — industry-level momentum is stable.

Combined returns and eps growth (SUGGESTION1 & S4). No vector/backfill. Confidence 0.60 — fundamentals confirm momentum.
SUGGESTION1: low recent volatility then breakout in returns; used volatility with high userCount (S4). Confidence 0.61 — breakout after contraction has edge.
Used PB and short returns per SUGGESTION1; PB coverage high and many users (S4). No vector/backfill. Confidence 0.58 — classic value reversal.
